title: LetтАЩs create Miniblock (including Miniblock / Microblock / Nanoblock) тАУ A cool hobby during Covid-19.
author: Autumn in October
story:
"Miniblock┬аis┬аmore┬аthan┬аa┬аtoy.┬аItтАЩs┬аan┬аartwork!"
┬а┬а
Hello! IтАЩm Q, Sittikorn Preechawuttidej. IтАЩve been interested in building Miniblock since December 2017 up until the present, which is over two years by now. I find that itтАЩs such a fascinating art and science combined as one. Along the way, IтАЩve discovered several techniques to create buildings and draft the plan. So, let me share my own experience and all knowledge IтАЩve gained throughout these years with you, and pass them to the new generations.

For any of you who may be interested to check out my works, please feel free to visit Qbrick Design. Thanks a lot for your interest and see you at https://www.facebook.com/QbrickDesign/

р╕Ир╕гр╕┤р╕Зр╣Ж р╕зр╕▒р╕Щр╣Бр╕гр╕Бр╕Бр╣Зр╕зр╣Ир╕▓р╕З р╣Бр╕Хр╣Ир╕Бр╣Зр╕зр╣Ир╕▓р╕Ир╕░р╕Юр╕▒р╕Бр╕Ыр╕гр╕▒р╕Ър╕Хр╕▒р╕з р╕вр╕▒р╕Зр╣Др╕бр╣Ир╕нр╕вр╕▓р╕Бр╕Лр╣Ир╕▓

Day 01 : Arrive at Leh. .Full day rest in Hotel to acclimatize the altitude 3500 meters. Night in Hotel.
┬а
Day 02 :┬а┬аVisit Shey Thiksay Hemis monasteries.Night in Hotel.

Day 03 : Leh тАУ Lamayuru тАУ┬а┬аleave for Lamayuru.┬а stop at Spituk, Phyang Magnetic Hill, Sangam and Pathar Sahib. Over night at Lamayuru.┬а

Day 04 : Lamayuru to Leh. . Visit Lamayuru┬а┬аmonastery in the morning. After visit drive back Leh. en route visit Alchi monastery. Overnight at Leh.
┬а
Day 05 :┬а┬аLeh тАУ Nubra :┬а┬аWake up fresh and slightly early today to enjoy a warm breakfast. Today we cross one of the highest motorable passes in the world, called Khardung La, at an altitude 17,582ft above mean sea level. Once across we head down into one of the most picturesque areas anywhere on the planet тАУ Nubra Valley. Snowcapped peaks, desert sand dunes with Bactrian camels, rivers, green grass and trees all greet you in the same glance! After exploring this absolutely scenic area, we stay overnight at Deluxe camp night. Meals included are Breakfast, lunch and dinner.
┬а
Day 06 : Nubra-┬а┬аPangong vis Syayok river, :┬а┬аThe total distance on this road between Nubra to Pangong Tso is approximately 140 kms and total travel time is about 6-8 hours. Road goes through Argham and Shyok village.┬а┬аThis┬а┬аroad will run right next to the Shyok river and then there will be a tremendous gain in altitude. But here are sections when you drive on the river bed (makes it impossible to cross in June- July when the water flow is at peak).. Ovenright Pangong lake. Yak Camp or similar.┬а
┬а
Day 07 : Pangong- Leh:┬а┬аDrive back to Leh┬а┬аen route visit, Thikse and Hemis monasteries,┬а┬а┬а┬аThikse monastery It is a Tibetan Buddhist monastery of the Yellow Hat School┬а┬а(Gelugpa)┬а┬аlocated on top of a hill, approximately 19 kilometres east of Leh in Ladakh, India. It is noted for its resemblance to the Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet. It is 25 km from Leh.

title: ......... upside down .........
author: р╕кр╕бр╕▓р╕Кр╕┤р╕Бр╕лр╕бр╕▓р╕вр╣Ар╕ер╕В 3799870
story:
.....

what if life was upside down
would sky be blue or brown?

would head walk upon ground ?
would one need shoes to walk around?

would one even sit in a chair?
when one's feet way up in the air

would roots grow up over clouds?
would one climb tree up or down?

would one trip over ceiling fans?
would shake feet instead of hands?

would every smile be a frown?
or would one's feet wear a crown?

would one's life be a mess?
confusing one's right from left

would people say 'bottom up'?
or would they spill a cup?

would one ask 'whats up?'
or would one ask whats down?

in the morning when wake in bed
would one be wake up or wake down instead?

the pictures that hang on the wall
would they stay, or would they fall?

and when writing what want to say
would the ink flow the other way?

and what if the world was square
would anyone even really care?

with these thoughts inside one's brain
could one be slowly .... going insane?

.....

.
